decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to quickly disrupt the opponent's mana base and board state by playing powerful and disruptive cards such as Blood Moon, Magus of the Moon, and Sundering Eruption. By utilizing fast mana sources like Simian Spirit Guide and Lotus Petal, the deck aims to lock down the opponent's resources while deploying aggressive threats like Broadside Bombardiers and Fury to close out the game quickly. The deck also includes card advantage engines like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Ghost Vacuum to maintain pressure and control the game.

The key concept of this Dimir Tempo deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while quickly applying pressure and controlling the board with efficient removal spells and counter magic. By utilizing disruptive cards like Thoughtseize, Force of Will, and Daze, along with powerful threats like Murktide Regent and Brazen Borrower, the deck aims to outpace the opponent and maintain tempo advantage throughout the game. The inclusion of cards like Fatal Push, Nihil Spellbomb, and Psychic Frog further enhances the deck's ability to control the battlefield and dictate the pace of the game.

This Dragon Stompy deck aims to disrupt opponents with cards like Blood Moon and The One Ring while beating them down quickly with aggressive creatures like Pyrogoyf and Broadside Bombardiers. The deck leverages mana acceleration from cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Chrome Mox to cast powerful spells like Sundering Eruption and Fury. The strategy revolves around applying pressure early and locking opponents out of the game with disruptive cards, ultimately overwhelming them with a relentless assault. The deck aims to finish games quickly before opponents can recover or stabilize.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with cards like Lotus Petal and Ancient Tomb to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and It That Heralds the End. Chalice of the Void disrupts opponent's plays, while Wasteland takes out their lands. The deck also utilizes cards like Glaring Fleshraker and Sowing Mycospawn to apply pressure and control the board. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and disrupt their game plan to achieve victory.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly generate mana using cards like Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal, while using Simian Spirit Guide and Elvish Spirit Guide for additional speed. The goal is to cast spells like Thoughtseize and Cabal Therapy to disrupt the opponent's game plan, before comboing off with Undercity Informer or Balustrade Spy to mill the entire library and win with Thassa's Oracle. Other key components of the deck include protection with Pact of Negation, graveyard recursion with Dread Return and Reanimate, and board control with Sink into Stupor and Fell the Profane.

The main concept of this UWx Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by countering spells, removing threats, and controlling the board with cards like Force of Will, Swords to Plowshares, and Daze. The deck aims to maintain card advantage with Brainstorm and Ponder while also generating value through cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Baleful Strix. With a mix of counterspells, removal, and card draw, the deck aims to control the game until it can close out with Murktide Regent or other threats. Additionally, the deck utilizes lands like Wasteland and Mystic Sanctuary for added utility.

The deck focuses on utilizing lands like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create powerful tokens quickly. It also includes control elements like Maze of Ith and Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Life from the Loam helps to repeatedly bring back key lands from the graveyard, while cards like Sylvan Library provide card draw to keep the engine going. Urza's Saga adds flexibility and additional threats to the deck, making it a versatile and powerful control archetype that can quickly take over the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing the combo of Show and Tell to put powerful cards like Omniscience and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn into play for free. It includes cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect the combo, as well as Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Atraxa, Grand Unifier for card advantage and control. The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats that are difficult to deal with. It also includes cards like Profane Tutor to help search for key combo pieces.

The main concept of this Legacy 1 vs 1 Mystic Forge combo deck is to generate mana quickly using cards like Ancient Tomb and Grim Monolith, then utilize cards like Mystic Forge and Manifold Key to play multiple artifacts in a single turn. The deck focuses on assembling a powerful board state with cards like Karn, the Great Creator and The One Ring, while also disrupting the opponent with Defense Grid. The goal is to overpower the opponent with massive creatures like Glaring Fleshraker and control the game with efficient artifact synergies.

The deck aims to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier using cards like Entomb and Reanimate. It utilizes cheap interaction like Daze and Force of Will to protect its combo pieces while utilizing Brainstorm and Ponder for consistency. The deck can also disrupt opponents with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push. Overall, the deck is focused on quickly reanimating powerful creatures to overwhelm opponents and win the game in a fast and efficient manner.

This deck is focused on dealing as much damage to the opponent as quickly as possible using burn spells and aggressive creatures. The key strategy is to maintain a fast pace and overwhelm the opponent with direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Fireblast. The deck also includes cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Monastery Swiftspear to increase the pressure on the opponent. With a low mana curve and efficient spells, this deck aims to win the game before the opponent can establish a strong defense.

The main concept of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana quickly and cast multiple spells in a single turn to build up a storm count. By utilizing cards like Dark Ritual, Lion's Eye Diamond, and Lotus Petal, the deck aims to reach a high storm count and win the game with Tendrils of Agony or another combo finisher. The inclusion of cards like Gaea's Will and Echo of Eons allows for potential card draw and recursion to further support the combo strategy. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Veil of Summer to protect against disruption from opponents.
